description: ["Manuscript of a collection of seven poems by Jami. Contents: 1. author's preface. -- 2. fol. 2b, Silsilat al-dhahab. --  3. fol. 90b, Salaman wa Absal  -- 4. fol. 106b, Tuhfat al-ahrar. -- 5. fol. 129b, Subhat al-Abrar. -- 6. fol. 169b, Yusuf u Zulaykha. -- 7. fol. 221b, Layla wa Majnun. -- 8. 268b, Khirad Nama Iskandari. Binding: 19th-century half calf with marbled paper over pasteboard."]
title: ['Haft Aurang']

binding: ['Yellow and red goatskin, covered in lacquer, painted with birds, flowers and butterflies. Rebacked.']

description: ['Manuscript commissioned by the Mughal emperor Akbar (1542-1605), containing stories by the Persian poet Jami (1414-1492), entitled Baharistan (Garden of spring).', 'Contents: MS. introduction by Sir Gore Ouseley entitled "Beharistan", dated Nov. 1817 (ff. iv-vii). Jami, Baharistan (ff. 1-67).', 'Extent: 67 leaves. 300 x 195 mm (written area 170 x 83, frame-ruled).', 'Layout: Written in 1 column of 14 lines.', 'Hand: Nastaʿlīq.', 'Decoration: Illuminated frontispiece; 6 miniature paintings by the Mughal court artists; the margins decorated throughout with gold patterns and figures, some painted.', 'Binding: 19th-century red velvet over cardboard with brass centrepiece and corner pieces on upper and lower covers.']
title: ['Baharistan']
author: ['Jami, 1414-1492']
catalogue-description: ['Fihrist: Union Catalogue of Manuscripts from the Islamicate World']
record-origin: ['Image descriptions based in part on Topsfield, A. (2007), Paintings from Mughal India.']
former-owner: ['Ouseley, Gore, Sir, 1770-1844', 'Shahjahan, Emperor of India, ca. 1592-1666', 'Akbar, Emperor of Hindustan, 1542-1605', 'Elliott, John Bardoe']
provenance: ['Written for Akbar (1542-1605); from the collection of Sir Gore Ouseley (1770-1844); from the collection of John Bardoe Elliott; presented to Bodleian Library 1859.']
